content: yahahaha designed by seth mungons supplies ◊ fingering weight yarn models use madelinetosh unicorn tails ◊ 7+ dpns 2 25 mm us 1 or whatever achieves an appropriate gauge ◊ tapestry & embroidery needles ◊ felt ◊ embroidery floss ◊ stuffing ◊ scissors ◊ stitch markers if desired ◊ a spirit of adventure & playfulness koroks require it if you don t have one your li l friend will be sad even before they exist 20 stitches and 26 row in 2 inches of stockinette or gauge whatever achieves a dense fabric stitches & abbreviations ◊ m1l make one left ◊ k2tog knit two together ◊ ssk slip slip knit ◊ sl1 slip one in this pattern it s assumed you re also wrapping à la german short row ◊ co cast on use longtail unless otherwise specified ◊ pu pick up technical notes ◊ the korok is knit from both directions you ll start by knitting a pair of cones & joining them together as the top of the korok then you ll grab some new needles and do the same for the body the two pieces are then grafted together and limbs are picked up from the main body the face is then cut embroidered and stitched in place ◊ there are some short row i use german short row and in pattern i just say turn and then sl1 wrap that slipped stitch to form a doubled stitch and remember to keep the next few stitches snug if you re using regular wraps and turns wrap the last stitch of each count & remember to pick up the wraps when you come to that stitch again ◊ when i say pick up stitches i mean you have a new stitch with new yarn i usually start the process by sliding my needles into one leg of each stitch i want to pick up from but those aren t the picked up stitches i then knit row 0 5 to get all of the stitches picked up round 13 sl1 p 3 turn round 14 sl1 k to end of round round 15 k 3 stitches begin joining head branches joining branches head holding needle with 3 stitches from branch 2 and you ll make 2 cones then join them together with a using the live yarn co 2 stitches using backwards few stitches between loop pick up branch 1 and knit all stitches with yarn carried over from branch 2 being sure to tug those branch 1 first few stitches to keep the cast on bridge tight co co 4 stitches another 2 stitches and knit 6 stitches from branch rounds 1-2 k all stitches 2 again keeping the first few snug this marks the round 3 k1 m1l k3 5 beginning of the round 3 stitches unworked they re round 4 k3 m1l k2 6 the first 3 stitches of the new round 28 stitches round 5 k5 m1l k1 7 knit 10 rounds then cut
